title: fix: preserve aspect ratio in klein-9b dimension clamping
author: voodoohop

gist.summary: Fixed an issue in the Klein-9B model where non-square images were being forced into a 1:1 square format.
gist.impact: Users can now generate wide or tall images with Klein-9B while maintaining the correct aspect ratio and resolution limits.
gist.visual_concept: The concept focuses on 'breaking out of the box'. The pollinations.ai bee is depicted adjusting a digital canvas or picture frame, transforming it from a rigid square into a wide, cinematic landscape format, symbolizing the restoration of proper aspect ratios.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of a tiny 8-bit bee character stretching a digital picture frame from a square into a wide landscape shape. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel gradient background. Chunky pixels, warm lighting, lo-fi aesthetic. Like Stardew Valley UI. Emotionally warm, nostalgic but beautiful.

image.prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of a tiny 8-bit bee character stretching a digital picture frame from a square into a wide landscape shape. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel gradient background. Chunky pixels, warm lighting, lo-fi aesthetic. Like Stardew Valley UI. Emotionally warm, nostalgic but beautiful.
